short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Toggles browser tab(s) type between normal and incognito (aka inprivate, private)

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
For frequent users of incognito mode, this extension helps you to make your experience smoother.

Currently, it helps you to switch one or more browser tabs from normal to incognito or vice versa with a single click. Also, you can decide whether the selected tabs will be added to a new window or to any existing window (of the same target type) using shortcuts or by changing options.

Features:
- Based on Manifest V3
- Provides two different operating modes via shortcuts.
- Add tabs to a new window or even any existing window.
- Multiple tabs support

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

# Post-installation instructions (for full and efficient use of the extension):
   > Pin the extension to the extension bar:
      - Click on the "Extensions" button on the extension bar and click on the "Pin" button against the extension name.

   > Allow the extension in Incognito mode:
      - Right click on the pinned extension button, then click "Manage extension" and turn on the "Allow in Incognito" option to make the extension work back and forth.

# General instructions:
   > Switching multiple tabs:
         - Press the "Ctrl" key and click on the desired tabs, and then press the extension icon or use any of the default shortcuts.

# Default Shortcuts:
   > Alt + I: Add tab(s) to an existing window.
   > Alt + O: Add tab(s) to a new window.

Note: In case, the shortcuts do not work due to some conflict, please set them manually "again" using the following page:
chrome://extensions/shortcuts
